Dear Ms. Stevens:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 3/2/21. Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been given
an application for renewal of the license not less than 60
calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
2 of 6 foster home files reviewed received their renewal applications less than 60
days prior to the expiration of their license.
R 400.12325 License recommendation.
(1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
appropriate licensing action consistent with facts contained in
the foster home evaluation and any special evaluations.
5 of 6 foster home files reviewed indicated in their re-evaluations that they did not
practice their emergency procedures quarterly but the 3080 stated there were no
licensing violations in the home.
R 400.12325 License recommendation.
(3) Except for an original license, an agency shall recommend to
the department the issuance of a regular license or the
continuation of an active license only when all rules are in
compliance or both of the following conditions exist:
(b) A written corrective action plan has been developed. The
plan shall be in compliance with all of the following
requirements:
(i) Specify the methods, the persons responsible, the time
frames for correction; methods for ensuring the safety of any
children placed in the home; how continuing compliance will be
maintained once compliance is achieved; consequences if the
corrective action plan is not completed; and what documentation
will be required to demonstrate compliance or completion.
4

1 of 3 Special Evaluations reviewed had a corrective action plan that was not
sufficient to ensure children’s safety.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
1 of 3 Initial Service Plan’s review was completed 18 days late.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
Policy FOM 722- TIMELY ENTRY OF CASEWORKER CONTACTS
06H
All face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS within
five business days of the contact.
5 of 14 face to face contact reviewed were completed late.
Repeat violation cited during the 2020 Renewal Inspection with a CAP
accepted on 3/9/20.
SRM 200 Fingerprints - CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD INFORMATION
(CHRI)
The information contained in the results and responses received
from applicant fingerprint-based criminal history searches is
considered Criminal History Record Information (CHRI). The
information contained in CHRI must be held to the same level of
security whether it is the original document or any other format.
3 of 4 adoption home files had the 612-CH in the home evaluation section of
MiSACWIS.

The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Ensure all sections of MiSACWIS is updated so the information generated
into the ISP and USP is correct.
5

V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
A Special Evaluation was completed on Foster Parent A’s home when it was
reported that her husband was being investigated for sexual abuse of his legal
daughter. While no violations were found regarding this allegation it was found that
Foster Parent A was putting soap in the children’s mouths when they used bad
words. She was found in violation of Rule 404 Behavior Management. The agency
implemented a corrective action plan, but it was not sufficient to keep the kids safe
from further corporal punishment. See the violation of R 400.12325 License
recommendation above.
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans not this
licensing period.
VII. ANALYST VISIT SUMMARY
The field analyst, Cynthia Szott, did not find any safety alerts at the homes she
visited. Any service concerns were brought up in the entrance conference with the
agency’s management team.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
